column1: nearly bowled him but it's four byes! An arm ball first up, he went back to cut but misread the seam up, it swung in sharply beat the inside edge and just went past leg stump and Latham missed it!
tossed up on off, he defends on the front foot
shorter length, he's back and cutting from tight to off, straight to point
a full toss and he leans on a cover-drive, placing it in the gap! A gift from Santner and Roy takes advantage
looped up higher and slower, he pushes on the front foot to cover-point
drifting into leg stump, he works this off the front foot through square leg for a single
hit on the pad but outside leg. There's shape in first up, nipping back and hitting the pad high
more swing down leg, it clips the pad and goes through to Latham. There's an appeal but it clearly came off pad
fuller, 130kph, shaping back and he drives handsomely but straight to mid off
134kph, back of a length on off, he's standing tall and defending back to the bowler
pinged off his toes forward of square! A half-volley slower ball on leg stump and Roy clips this away beautifully through the gap forward of square
shorter length, 136kph, outside off, he's up on his toes and punching through cover point, finding the gap for a couple
134kph, shorter length outside off, he's up on his toes and knocking this down off the back foot
135kph, shorter outside off, some outswing, he tries to cut but mistimes to point
glorious back foot drive through cover! It was just short of a length outside off, he stood up and cracked it through extra cover with a vertical bat. Great timing
square drive in the air but in the gap! It was a length ball, wide, he threw his hands through it and hit it chest high through cover-point but dissected the fielders in the ring and it ran away
132kph, good length, nipping back a touch, gets a thick inside edge onto the front pad

an edge but it runs safely well wide of first slip, it would have been wide of second, third man has to run around from a wide position to cut it off. That was a good length and line, forcing a defensive prod
137kph, good length, top of off, he stays leg side and defends with soft hands
136kph, fourth stump line, not that short, he's back and cutting ambitiously past backward point wide of third man
136kph, back of a length, angled across, he cuts but gets a bottom edge that bounces to slip
133kph, swinging down leg and it comes off pad and runs fine. Too straight, shaping down leg and Roy will be annoyed he didn't get bat on it. The team gets four anyway
136kph, shorter length outside off, he tries to heave a pull shot, miscues it dragging it to square leg
play and miss reaching at a wide ball angled across but it was inside the guideline. Roy is batting outside leg
good length, angled into middle and off, he defends from the crease to midwicket
133kph, back of a length, he's back and punching to mid on
angled into the pads and clipped away beautifully through midwicket. That was a half volley, no swing and it was picked off
lifted just over Santner at cover! Again some width, he freed the arms and lifted a drive over the man leaping on the ring and away for four
smashing pull shot! 129kph chest high short ball just sat up and he clubbed a pull shot rolling his wrists to get it forward of square
angled into leg stump, he clips this through square leg to the sweeper who is now back
beaten by a beauty! A good length, angled in, nipping across, it squared him up and flew past the edge
138kph, good length outside off, he drives elegantly on the rise straight to mid off
139kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
thumping drive on the up through the vacant cover! It wasn't a half volley but there's no swing, he just clubs it on the up in the air but there is no one at cover.
back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover-point
137kph, back of a length off stump, he stands tall on the back foot defending with the full face
Roy skips down to a 134kph, length ball, he bunts this with a slight leading edge but safely short of mid on for a single
angled into leg stump, he leans forward and times this through the gap at midwicket for a couple
fuller outside off, he drives nicely straight to mid off
off cutter slower ball pushes down the leg side
139kph, good length, angled into middle and off, he punches off the back foot to mid on
139kph, fuller on off, he pushes straight of mid on, times it well but can't beat the man running across on the circle
full and speared down leg, it comes off Roy's pad and Latham makes the rolling stop
135kph, good length, fourth stump line, he drives imperiously through the line on the up, to straight mid off on the circle
140kph fuller outside off, he defends with firm hands and it pings off the bat to point
pull shot hammered forward of square! Another chest high short ball, he swivelled and crunched it forward of square and the sweeper stood no chance of getting to it
good length, fourth stump line, he defends with softer hands on the front foot
139kph, fuller outside off, he mistimes a drive dragging it to mid on
nearly chopped on! Good length outside off, he drives on the up, gets a thick inside edge but it bounces past leg stump
full outside off, it just holds up a touch as he drives, he drags it to mid on
no timing driving off a thick inside edge that flies through forward square to the man in the deep
full, 137kph, angled into leg stump, he whips in the air through square leg to the sweeper
top edge over the keeper! It was only 133kph, but a well directed short ball, quite high, he pulls but gets a top edge that flies way over the keeper and nearly goes for six! It landed just short
fuller on middle, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
138kph, back of a length wide of off, he opens the face and runs this off the back foot to third man
135kph, fuller outside off, he drives without great timing to cover
back of a length on off, he chops this off the bottom edge and it bounces high over the stumps to the keeper
133kph, full toss outside off, he misses out, toeing this towards mid on
136kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this away behind square to the man in the deep
135kph good length, fourth stump, he drives on the up to mid off
136kph, good length outside off, he drives on the rise to cover and Guptill makes a good diving stop
full on leg stump, he clips this off the pads behind square
141kph, good length on off, he defends from the back foot into the off side
136kph, good length, on off, he drives on the up with no timing to mid off
131kph, length ball, nipping back, he works to midwicket
138kph, full on middle, he drives firmly but straight to mid on
138kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
tossed up, he drives inside out wide of long off for a couple
133kph, good length on off, he drives neatly with a flowing bat to mid on
shorter length outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
shorter length, he's back and whacking this firmly down to long on
tossed up, some drift in, he drives firmly to long off
90kph, full, he drives inside out, in the air but square of cover, the man at deep point has to work to his right to cut it off
driven firmly on the up to mid on
magnificent straight drive! Over-pitched, he leaned forward and played a text book straight drive. It went like a bullet to the fence
shorter length, he pulls easily through square leg to the sweeper
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
back of a length, 137kph, he's back and wheeling this with the bottom hand square of midwicket with nice placement for a couple
he charges and flat bats this on the up along the ground straight of mid off but can't beat the man on the circle
thumping drive through cover! The man saving one just stood and watches it race past him like a missile! This was too full and he climbed into it with fast hands and great placement
tossed up, 88kph, he drives powerfully to straight long off
drifting into leg, he works this off the front foot square of midwicket and an early call allows for a quick single
he skips out early, it's a fraction short, he has to defend on the move
slower and drifting into leg, he's back and whipping this to deep forward square
91kph, pushed through of off, he's back and defending to midwicket
120kph, good length on off, he drives on the up with ease to long off
lovely little glide wide of short third man! It was a good length but wide of off, he opened the face and ran a delicate late cut with of short third man. Superb placement
good length on middle, he drives on the up to long on
116kph, fuller outside off, he drives easily to long off
angled into leg stump, he mistimes this to midwicket and is frustrated
again glided wide of short third man! Supreme skill and touch. This was closer to off, but he watched it closely, gave himself some room and late cuts beautifully
91kph, flatter drifting into middle, he punches back to the bowler
slid through quicker, he's back and mistiming a cut as it stays low, gets it to the gap at point
drifting into middle, he stays back and punches off the back foot to midwicket
shorter length, he's back and square driving through point
shorter on leg, he forces off the back foot but can't beat the man at midwicket
91kph, fired into off, he gives room and tries to slap this down the ground, he mistimes it dragging it to long on
good length on off, 134kph, he's squared up defending on the front foot
135kph, good length outside off, he pushes firmly on the front foot past point
127kph, fuller on off, he mistimes a drive to mid off
good length wide of off, 134kph, he square cuts but straight to backward point
127kph, angled into leg stump, he glances this with ease wide of fine leg for a couple
good length, fourth stump, he defends but gets an outside edge with soft hands to third man
pushed onto the back foot, eased out to point, tight lines to off stump
tidy line and length from Southee, attacking the top of off and drawing a respectful block, with slightly neutral footwork
swinging away from an off-stump line, more forceful this time from Bairstow, out to point with a flash of the wrists
a gallop and smack from Roy, dancing to the pitch, and lumped out to wide mid-off with a big followthrough. Intercepted with a slide
flogged firmly to deep cover, lots of lovely bat swing in evidence there. But not quite timed
cramped on the back foot, but pumped firmly past the bowler to long-on. Another single to complete a tidy over
swinging into the legs, an attempted waft across the line but can't connect this time
short, wide, battered with disdain high over mid-on! It sat up in the pitch, begged to be beaten, and there's a long chase, but a futile one, down to the rope
majestic power and poise! But that's hare-brained bowling, far too short from Neesham, far too wide as well, Roy rocks back and plunders it through midwicket!

it was all a set-up after all! Fuller, straighter, Roy has punched this on the up, no footwork this time, and short cover has snaffled a dolly! The much-needed opening has been prised... Roy is aghast. He had the bowling at his mercy!
defended on the back foot, tight line and length as Root slides back and across
too wide this time from Neesham, easy pickings for Root, who rolls his wrists on a measured drive to deep cover and jogs off the mark
flipped off the toes
stretching into a drive, back past the bowler and gathered with a slide at mid-on
opens the face and guides it to point
speared into the pads, sharp running as square leg gives chase
short-arm pull! Have some of that, that's power and placement. Not especially short, but cudgelled across the line with Popeye forearms, clean through midwicket
pumped leg-side once more, anything even fractionally short is getting the treatment. But this time the sweeper swoops to limit the damage
nurdled down to third man in that familiar release shot
punched drive, tight lines to off stump
outside off, good pace off the deck, Bairstow defends with a belated hop into line
short and quite sharp, back of a length and outside off. Bairstow flinches as he drops his hands
loopy slower ball, dipping towards the stumps and clipped to midwicket with mild bemusement
on the legs, sharp timing once more but just the single to the square leg sweeper
flicked off the legs to short backward square
hauled behind square for another boundary! Too short once again, Bairstow leant back on an under-edged pull ... and got plenty on it to beat the field
worked into the gap once more to keep things ticking
full and speared into the toes, a sharp single as the shy comes in from square leg. Safely home
tight lines, defended back down the pitch
up on the toes, poked back down the pitch
nudged to short third man
on the back foot, that's placed to perfection, right to the edge of the long boundary at deep extra cover. A long chase for two fielders as England return for the third
flogged from a full length back down the track. Mid-off tidies up
short, good lift outside off as Bairstow leans inside the line to leave
whipped off the pads to the leg side
tucked to mid-on to dot up the over
put the rubbish in the bin! That's a wide half-tracker from Santner! Meat and drink for Bairstow, who pivots onto the back foot and lambasts a pull through cow corner!
opens the face with a fleet-footed cut into the covers. The 150 is up...
head right over the ball now. Blocked back down the pitch
cheeky from Root! Drops to one knee, reverses the hands, ramps the off-stump delivery over the keeper's head for another boundary
stretching right forward, onto the front foot. Emphatic defence
flicked off the pads, in the air for a moment, but wide of the diving short midwicket
sliced in the air, down to third man
flicked off the pads, trying to make an angle into the leg side but can't quite achieve it
tapped down to backward point, using the width to keep the strike rotating
pumped with firm forearms, Henry at mid-on wears it in the chest as it bounces awkwardly in front of him
full and straight, Root is onto the front foot, pressing it back past the bowler, who sticks out a hand in the hope of flicking it onto the stumps. Bairstow scrambles back to avoid any accidents
another measured clip off the legs, no pace on the shot so they have time to hurtle back for the second. Excellent placement
opens the face for a dab into the off side
flicked outside off ... was that a drop? Sounded like two noises as it clanged off the gloves. Never a real chance to react if it was...
worked off the legs, more cunning placement to make one into two
clever bowling! The arm-ball drifting inexorably in and sliding past off stump as Bairstow cuts belatedly and misses
finds the single with the nudge into the covers
pushed firmly into the gap once more, cover rushes around but these two are so quick between the wickets. Runs galore, but they are being stealthily gathered at the moment
whittled off the pads to backward square leg
short and climbing over the batsman's head. The umpire gives his arms a stretch
angled bat, dabbed down to third man, using the width to keep the singles ticking
hopping back and across, fenced into the cordon, cramped on off stump
full length, driven to short cover with a flow of the blade through the line
slower ball outside off, Bairstow opens the face and guides a dab to point
chopped hard  but straight to point again, Bairstow looks mildly peeved at giving up three dot balls in a row
outside off, dabbed to third man
tight lines, inside-edged defence down into the crease
very full, high-elbowed drive through the line of the ball, to mid-on
worked off the legs for another single

donked over the bowler's head! Full, in the arc, luring the big heave through the line. He got more under it than through it, but it was arrow-straight and perfectly safe, plopping comfortably over the rope!
nudged to the leg side
back of a length, opens the face, tapped to third man
back of a length, tight to the stumps, a hurried pull, rolling the wrists on impact for a single to midwicket
full length, tapped back down the pitch
steered down to third man, Root brings up 500 runs for this World Cup!
firmly pushed into the covers, half-forward on the off stump
outside off, back of a length, cut to backward point
pressed into the covers, firm wrists on the open-faced drive
driven once more, but without conviction
big inswinger, Southee is convinced! A huge delay from umpire Ravi, but a belated shake of the head. That was surely swinging past leg... indeed it was, by a distance
short, pulled, Bairstow moves to 96! Rolls his fingers, but that was too easy to pick off as it shaped into the hip. Easy through backward square
forward and into the covers

back-to-back hundreds from Jonny Bairstow! Stunning resolve from England's opening batsman. This one was on the pads once more, tucked square with good timing, into the gap, and it rolled inexorably to the rope.

short, down the leg side and Root has been given out! He flapped into a pull, appeared to feather an edge, and yet he has reviewed... so, the bat was adjacent as the ball flew by ... and there's a murmur on Snicko... it's not a spike as such, but it's enough to send him on his way! Root seems bemused, but the evidence upheld the onfield call.
pressed into the covers
pressing onto the front foot, worked into the covers once more
too full, outside off, and that is a lovely crisp push to get off the mark! Bending the knee into the drive, and piercing the covers with ease
round the wicket, banged in short, Buttler pulls but miscues into the off side
pulled forcefully out to the leg side, up comes the 200 as the umpires signal for drinks.
130kph, fuller outside off, he drives but it comes off the toe to cover
he times this cover drive and picks the gap! A wide half-volley, he times this better than the previous ball and split the gap between cover and mid off.
131kph, short and wide, he cuts through point, the man on the rope has to move to his left, Bairstow takes on the throw and beats it

he's played on! Out of nowhere! Did not see that coming. It was a full outswinger again wide of off, but it just hit the seam and straightened a touch, he drives away from his body playing for a little bit more shape, it comes off a thick inside edge and cannons into the stumps.
131kph, bouncer first up. No shock here. He drops the knees and sways under it easily
133kph, back of a length, he shoulders arms staying leg side of it letting it go over middle and off
short and wide, he hammers a cut shot and Guptill makes a goalkeeper type stop parrying it away. That was hammered
fuller on leg, he drives towards mid on
137kph, very full on middle, he pushes a drive straight of mid on for an easy one
128kph, full and wide of off, he drives inside out to deep cover-point with ease
back of a length outside off, he swivels on a pull shot, doesn't nail it but gets it behind square
134kph, chest high short ball, he latches onto a pull but rolls the wrists, nailing it to deep square
136kph, angled into middle, he whips this easily through forward square to the sweeper
fuller on off, he stays leg side and drives to mid off
135kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease half-forward
high short ball, 137kph, he knows it's coming and takes on the pull staying leg side, rolling the wrists to get it behind square
131kph, full on middle, he clips this easily forward of square to the sweeper
shorter length, he punches off the back foot but mistimes
good length, on off, he pushes off the front foot back to the bowler

caught at mid off! This is a horrible miscue from Buttler. He clothed this drive and it floated to the Williamson on the circle! It was up and he decided to try and hit through the line but just mistimed it completely. Not sure if it was a cutter that held in the surface. Didn't appear to be. Boult was ecstatic.
full and tailing down leg, he glances this with ease to fine leg
136kph, shorter into the hip, he gets the front leg up and pulls around the corner to fine leg
good length, outside off, he's caught on the crease, gets a thick edge that runs along the ground fine of third man for a couple
good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
129kph good length, across the left hander, he tries to run to third man, backward point comes around and they don't take an obvious one
good length, middle and off, he stays leg side and defends into the off side
short ball and he gloves a pull shot fine! Not in control. It was high down leg and he took it on but got it off the gloves to fine leg
slashed wide of third man! This was well timed and placed. 126kph, wide and fractionally short, he thrashed his hands through it and placed it wide of third man
fuller on leg, he defends with the full face back to the bowler
136kph, good bouncer, he shaped to pull but bailed out as it got big on him
127kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot
he skips down the track to turn a good length into a drivable one, but picks out cover
fuller on off, 130kph, he mistimes a drive back to the bowler
134kph, good length, on off, he jams the bat down and gets an inside edge onto pad
back of a length, wide of off, he pushes from the crease to point but can't beat the fielder

Morgan nearly cooked by Stokes! Santner missed an underarm. Stokes bunted this towards mid off and called yes then no. Morgan had to turn back. The ball bounced up into Santner's arms running across from cover, he flicked the underarm but missed! Morgan's dive was short
shorter length wide of off, he runs this off the open face to third man
good length on off, he slices a drive straight to point
back of a length on off, he's up on his toes punching without timing to cover-point
136kph, short ball, it comes off the surface slowly, he pulls with control behind square
good length, 129kph, across him, he played and missed trying to run to third man
and again he misses trying to run it third man. Too close and full for that shot
130kph, shorter and wider of off, he checks a cut shot to deep point
142kph, fuller outside off, it holds in the surface, he mistimes a drive dragging it to midwicket
shorter length, he stands up and heaves this across the line to deep forward square
shorter length, outside off, he opens the face and runs to third man
126kph, slower cutter outside off, he tries to cut but mistimes to cover
fuller outside off, again he drives flowingly but straight to the man at cover
full drifting to leg stump, he misses a whip and is taken on the pad
fired miles down the leg side. Bizarre ball
tossed up on leg, he drives along the ground to long on
drifting across him outside off, he leans out and pushes this to the gap at cover-point
shorter length, he's back and cutting this forward of point to the gap and they run well for two
flatter on middle, he's back and bunting this to midwicket
he sweeps this past short fine! He darted this full into leg stump, and Morgan got it on the full, roping it past short fine to the fance
good yorker, right at the base of off, he jams the bat down and digs it out
130kph, fuller length outside off, he drives on the up to wide mid off but only gets one. Can't beat the man
back of a length on off, he stays leg side and defends with soft hands close into the off side and they pinch one
124kph, fuller outside off, he pushes a check drive straight to cover
he charges at a wider ball and slices this wide of third man for a couple
full on the pads and he whips this through square leg
fuller on leg, he whips it straight to midwicket
full outside leg, he tries to sweep but is taken on the pad. He's hit well outside the line of leg
tossed up on leg, he drives to long on
darted outside leg again, he tries to sweep and is taken on the pad
cracking reverse sweep from leg side but nailed straight to deep backward point and CdG makes the sliding save

holes out to long on! The pressure got to him! He delivered another flatter ball on leg, he tried to launch down the ground but couldn't get the timing or elevation. He hit it flat and straight to Henry on the rope. Henry pouched the simple chance.
nearly a drag on! 138kph outside off, he drives away from his body and gets a thick inside edge, it goes wide of leg stump. Wasn't that close actually
good length, fourth stump, he defends from the crease getting a thick inside edge to midwicket
135kph, fuller outside off, he drives inside out to cover
back of a length, 134kph, he is back whipping this with no timing to midwicket
beaten trying to drive on the up outside off through point
beaten again by a back of a length leg cutter! He was squared up trying to run to third man
93kph, good length on leg, he steps forward and defends
slower outside off, he is back and cutting to backward point for a tight one
drifting into leg, he whips this to midwicket and Williamson misfields. He would be annoyed he let Woakes off strike
darted down the leg side and called wide
drifting outside off, he defends this to cover-point for a single
flighted very high and slow, he has to wait on the front foot and pushes to cover
drifting into off, he drives firmly to long off
135kph, fired way down the leg side and rightly called wide
134kph, length ball wide of off, he mistimes a drives to deep cover-point
135kph, good length, it holds in the surface, he drives and gets a thick inside edge that runs to fine leg
back of a length outside off, he is back and runs this to third man
banged in back of a length, it sits in the surface, he is back and pulling to deep forward square

caught at mid off! Neesham has been excellent! This was a full length, shaping in a touch, he tried to drive inside out but lofted it flat to Williamson on the circle at mid off and he takes the catch well above his eyes
good length, top of off, he defends from the crease. Outstanding spell from Neesham complete
lofted beautifully over mid off! Pace on the ball helped here. It was pitched up and he just drives through the line, timing this over mid off on the circle and away to the rope
good length, 130kph, he pushes on the front foot to mid on for one
133kph, shorter ball, he's rushed trying to pull and chips this in the air but safe forward of square
full on middle, he drives powerfully straight of long on and the man on the rope is forced to work to his right
pulled nicely behind square into the gap! This was a head high bumper but he swivels and gets on top of it, pulling it down behind square to the rope
full outside off, he drives to long off

brilliant catch from Santner at cover! A slower ball off cutter does the trick. It was full outside off, held in the surface, he checks a drive head high at cover, Santner is close, he moves left initially and then flings his hands up to his right and clings on falling backwards. Super catch. Good piece of bowling.
115kph, slower ball outside off, he sits back and runs this to third man, Rashid thinks about two and goes late, he just beats the throw. They check with TV umpire but he was well home
angled down the leg side and called wide
shorter length, on leg, he tucks this off the hip behind square, wants two but it's not on
short slower ball that dies in the surface as he tries to pull. He missed it by a long way
slower ball outside off, 116kph, he dabs this with soft hands into the gully
good length slower ball cutter outside off, he defends to backward point
133kph, very full, speared into middle, he drives firmly to long on
full but down the leg side and another wide
lofted high in the air over cover, it hangs up there for an eternity but the sweeper running off the rope can't get there to the drop. They get two
good length on off, he sits back and gets low and dabs this to short third man, if you don't mind!
good length, 126kph, outside off, he swings hard but chops it off the bottom edge behind square

dropped by Southee at long on! He went one handed and made a mess of it. It was swung lustily to long on, it may have just dropped on Southee late and he dived forward with the one hand but couldn't claim it
shorter into the hip, he glances this off the hip to fine leg
lofted over mid off! Good shot this. He cleared the left leg and opened the hips to free the arms, lifting a length ball over mid off and it races away
he backs away to leg and late cuts this from leg stump to third man
heaved away behind square! Length ball, top of off, he swung hard and heaved it behind square, very agricultural but effective. He found the gap
136kph, shorter, he pulls this behind square again but the man has been moved, Plunkett wants two and gets back
skied pull shot but it falls short of the man running in from the long boundary
117kph, high short slower bouncer, he plays a tennis smash type pull behind square, the sweeper runs in to cut off two
130kph, full outside off, he's smearing a drive to cover on the circle and they pinch one
131kph, full on off, he sits back and heaves this down to long on along the ground
outstanding yorker cannons into leg stump! This was the perfect yorker. Tailing in late, he tried to give room but it sneaked under the bat and slammed into the base of leg. Not much Rashid could do
another full inswinging yorker, not quite as full, he swings hard and drives it down to long on
full inswinger, he swings hard and gets it into the gap at wide long on, they push for two to get Plunkett back on strike and Archer beats the throw! They check upstairs but he was in easily
low full toss, he clears the front leg and heaves this away to deep square leg and they only get one
outside off, curling away, left alone from just back of a length
pushed back into the crease, nice tight lines to open his account. Blocked into the off side
swinging past the hip, New Zealand are up and running
full and straight, Guptill jams his bat down to dig it out
tap and go, into the off side and through they scamper

pinned on the pad-flap and the finger is up before the appeal is out! No messing from Woakes, or Umpire Ravi. He was back on the crease, hit him above the knee-roll on an off-stump line... might have been clipping, but golly!
pushed right back onto the crease, defended in front of off stump. That's an agenda-setting over from Woakes, once more!
skimming into the pads from back of a length
tentatively forward, a jittery inside-edge into the pads
through to the keeper, left alone
short and sharp! Guptill limbos inside the line, as Archer bends his back for the first time today
back on a full length outside off, through to the keeper
on the pads, nurdled square, another single to the cause
lovely wheels from Woakes, fully greased as Williamson takes a sighter outside off
attacking the off stump, pushed into the off side
nipping back off the seam, and thuds the knee-roll
fenced out to the off side, off the back foot
beautifully placed, out through the gap in the covers, rising onto the toes to ease an open-faced drive to the brink of the rope
back of a length, hitting the deck hard on an arrow-straight line. Blocked down into the crease
blocked off the back foot, just a regulation 90mph dot ball
full length, tight line, Williamson leans forward, head over the ball to defend back to the bowler
this is fine disciplined new-ball bowling. Line, length, a bit of pace, and no width. Defended once more
sharpt Williamson drops the hands and sways inside the line as Archer drags his length back. Not so much a bouncer as a lifter, passing the chest at a brisk pace!
pushing 150kph this time as Williamson lets another sail by
completes the maiden over with another lifter, just back of a length, poked to the off side with a bottom-handed jab
nurdled to Plunkett on the leg side, who whistles in a tight shy that misses by a whisker
punched off the back foot, rising to meet the tight line once again. Seven dots in a row to the skipper...
an open-faced dab, right under the nose outside off, one of Williamson's standard release shots, and eludes the two slips
solid and emphatic! Big stride, perpendicular bat, thumped so straight back down the pitch, it's a mystery how it skimmed past the non-striker's stumps. Held the pose for good measure too. Top marks
props forward for a block to cover
nudged to the leg side as Woakes tails one into the pads, clipped gently to midwicket
rising on off stump, another trademark dab to third man to keep his innings moving

utterly sensational from Buttler! That was a fat glance down the leg side, taking a deflection off the glove, but Buttler's footwork was already on the march, a cartwheeling take, stretching fully to his left and clinging on in a single glove! Archer's pace forced the error, even when his line was awry, and New Zealand's opening issues get them deep in trouble once again
bashed with firm footwork into the covers
eased down to mid-off
lovely languid pace from Archer once again, 89mph this time, but a tight line to the body, back of a length, Williamson has to drop his hands and let it sail by
flashed up and over the slips! To be fair, he played that well, guiding it wide of the cordon, but short of third man. But it goes to show how limited the scoring options are right now ...
back and across, to defend on the back foot
poked into the off side once more, so little to work with
trying to force something more extravagant through the covers, but even when rising onto the toes on contact, there's no way through the covers
banging out that tidy line and length once again, a click of bat as Williamson pushes firmly into the covers again
nurdled to perfection! Right back on the stumps, opens the face on impact, and threads a low nick, quite deliberately between keeper and slip!
closes the face on impact this time to work the ball back up the pitch. Slim pickings!
blocked with a full face, on the back foot. Straight back to the bowler
pressed into the covers, line and length to the fore
squared up in defence, on the back foot, cover is back in business to tidy up
bouncer, and a brisk one too! Wide of off stump, so Taylor is lured into the pull, but at 91mph, it's through him before his bat arrives
defended on the back foot, so tight to the off stump
just a nugget of width, and a grateful slash to third man, rolling the wrists to take it past point
aggressive lines from Woakes, bending back into the off stump from a slightly wider line, and defended once more
jabbed in the air, and Woakes can't reach it! Squared up on his pads by one that gripped in the pitch, popped off a leading edge, but died just short of the tumbling bowler
fenced to third man, back of a length and a single will suffice

solid, quality! Out of the blue, Williamson nails a drive. He's waited, and waited, taken his licks and blocked out several. But all of a sudden, there's one that's fractionally over-pitched, and his perfect placement does the rest
whittled into the leg side, finds the gap at deep midwicket
stuck in the crease this time, on the back foot and blocked with a lack of footwork
flicked off the toes, a decent stop by the diving Rashid
belted through the covers! The best stroke of New Zealand's innings, it was a bit of a floaty half-volley, but encouragingly for New Zealand, both Taylor and Williamson remain alive to opportunities
hops back to block into the leg side, takes the single as midwicket swoops
flicked off the pads again, out to the leg side
bangs the glove with a 92mph lifter! Taylor didn't know much about that one, dug into the ribs and flinched in the air past the non-existent short leg
wheels from Archer! Bending his back once more, another cobra-like bouncer, spitting over an off-stump line as Taylor sways back
back of a length, Taylor hops into line to defend
stabbed into the off side
wider line, doesn't come onto the back as expected as Williamson looks rather crestfallen as he fails to time his push into the covers
another of Williamson's neutral stabs to third man. Full and under the nose, outside off, an open face and a good eye do the needful
attempting something similar, but point is on point to gather this time
Taylor borrows the same trick, steering the single to third man
sliding past the leg stump
angled down the leg side once again, a thin deflection helps it on its way

well played! Outside off, rising sharply, and Williamson takes on the chance, punching an open-faced drive down into the turf and past the sprawling backward point. Despite being stuck in treacle for long periods, his innings is still ticking over ...
defended late, underneath the nose, into the leg side
defended with conviction, on the back foot
attacking line, targetting the off stump, blocked away with firm hands into the covers
fuller length, into the toes, tucked with the angle to midwicket. Wood finishes his over better than he started it, and New Zealand's task stiffens once more
back of a length, Plunkett always has a sweeper in place on the cover boundary to limit the damage
back of a length, closing the face on impact to work it off the hip
just a touch of width, cracked hard out to deep point
driven sweetly out to the sweeper once more
back of a length, wide line, but that's how Plunkett rolls. Another slash to the square boundary, but gathered by the sweeper again
back of a length, so hard to line him up in this period. Williamson hops across to defend on off stump
back of a length, seems to skid a touch as Taylor defends his stumps with a very straight blade
eased to the leg side, picking off the tight line into the legs
tucked to square leg
nudged down to third man, brief excitement as Buttler's relay shy pings the non-striker's stumps, but Williamson is safely home
a flash outside off, another single to third man. Slim pickings ...
angled into the pads, tapped to mid-on
outside off, a slashing chop to a wide line, skids under the blade and through to the keeper
angled to third man
fully forward and drilled to cover
punched into the covers
opens the face for another dab to third man, picking off the wide line outside off
fuller, and dipping into the pads ... deflected behind square for the single

punched back down the pitch, and Wood is appealing for the run-out! Wow, this would be massive ... was Williamson out of his crease. Yep, there's a clear fingertip on the ball as Wood stretched across the crease... and Williamson is nowhere to be seen! This will be OUT! Wood sucks his finger in celebration as the Big Screen confirms it!
good length, nipping away a touch, he spars at it outside off and misses
Superb pull shot forward of square and Bairstow can't make the save! 143kph, high bouncer, he did well to hit it down well infront of square and the timing was excellent
143kph, good length, fourth stump line, he chops down on it to get it to backward point
angled into leg stump, he works this neatly behind square
good length on middle and off, he clips this through midwicket, they run hard and Stokes misfields at deep midwicket to allow a second
flash and miss trying to square drive on the up to a 131kph length ball wide of off
132kph, good length, outside off, he tries to run to third man but can't beat the backward point who is tight
fuller on off, he drives nicely but straight to cover

Taylor has run himself out! Crazy! He glanced this to fine leg and decided to take on a risky second. The throw from Rashid was on the money, Buttler didn't have to do much and Taylor diving at full stretch was well short. The third umpire only needed one replay to see that. No idea why Taylor took that on.
132kph, full outside off, he squeezes this to backward point
fuller on leg, he glances this behind square but just one
tossed up on off, he leans forward and defends
88kph slower and similar length but he goes back and pushes to cover
drifting into off, and no turn, he drives off the inside edge onto pad and it rolls into the leg side
lovely paddle sweep from off the stumps, gets it fine for a couple
full on off, he drives neatly to long on
flatter on middle, he pushes firmly to long on
wrong un, he's back and mistiming it to cover
leg break down leg, he glances this fine of fine leg for a couple
shorter on leg, he's back and tucking this through square leg
82kph, leg break on leg stump, he works this off the front foot through square leg
tossed up, on off, he drives firmly to long off
shorter and wider of off, he's back and thumping this through cover to the fence! Good shot. Too short and he waited and hammered it into the gap
darted into leg, he's cramped going back to defend
drifting into leg stump, he defends this towards midwicket for a single
drifting down leg, he sweeps but doesn't time it, gets it straight to short fine
angled into leg, he is on the front foot turning this around the corner
fired wide of off, he's back and cutting but straight to backward point
fuller on off, he drives firmly to long off
shorter wrong un, he's back and punching to deep cover
he's down and paddle sweeping fine for a couple
shapes to paddle again but this slides on and hits the back thigh but it was missing off
punched off the back foot straight of mid off! What a shot this is! Great timing and placement to beat mid off who is quite wide
looped up on leg, he works this with the turn wide of long on for a couple
wrong un, he reads it very late, opens the face, gets a thick edge fine of short third man
tossed up on off, he drives back to the bowler
tossed up again, he yorks himself trying to drive to cover
shorter length, he's back and pulling powerfully to deep midwicket but can't find the gap
short and wide and he cuts nicely past backward point! Bad ball and Neesham is back and placing this past backward point. 100 comes up
drifting into leg, he pushes this slowly to the gap at midwicket, they push for two but Bairstow raced in to keep it to one
shorter on leg, he's back and working this through square leg
short on the hip, he tucks this to fine leg easily
129kph, full on middle, he defends on the front foot to cover
back of a length on off, 130kph, he's back and running this to third man
131kph, back of a length outside off, he defends from the crease to point
fuller on leg, he works this off his pads to midwicket
128kph, short into the hip, he works this behind square, Latham takes on the throw for two but Bairstow's throw was a little wide
142kph, cracking bouncer, right at the head, he drops a knee and sways late to get his head inside the line
back of a length, 144kph, he defends from the crease to gully
angled into the pads, it pitched outside leg, it comes off thigh pad and rolls to midwicket for a leg bye
141kph, short into the ribs, he clips this away behind square into the gap, well placed
full on leg stump, he flicks this away beautifully forward of square, Root has to run a long way and makes a diving save to the crowd screaming ROOOOOT!!!
147kph, angled into leg stump, he clips this behind square to the man in the deep
130kph, back of a length, he's back and defending with soft hands into the off side and calls Latham through
slower ball cutter, 121kph, angled down leg, it wasn't far from leg stump but it was called wide
short on the hip, he works this down to fine leg
good length, 130kph, on leg, he defends from the crease
short on leg stump, he's back and working this through square leg

classical cover drive on the rise and Root can't save this one! Supreme timing to hit this on the up through extra cover. Root got to it but couldn't make the save as he was diving towards the rope, he parried it onto the boundary
good length on leg, he clips this neatly but straight to midwicket

chopped on! Change of angle works! It was back of a length outside off but sliding in and staying a touch low, he tried to cut but it came off the inside edge and cannoned onto the stumps! The crowd loved that
146kph, good length angled in, it catches him on the thigh guard, beaten for pace
beaten outside off trying to drive off the back foot. That was too quick for de Grandhomme
145kph, he mistimes a drive back past the bowler who can't field because he's fallen over, de Grandhomme takes a tight one. It should have been easy but he was touch slow to get going
149kph, back of a length, angled in from around the wicket, he's back and defending to midwicket
148kph, back of a length on off, he defends from the crease
132kph, angled down leg and it comes off the pad on the way through to Buttler. England appeal but it was half hearted
130kph, yorker tailing in, he does well to jam down and dig this out
play and miss trying to square drive off the back foot. It was 134kph but pretty straight outside off
back of a length cutter, it comes in and takes him on the thigh as he tries to work to leg
back of a length outside off, he's punching this off the back foot to deep cover-point
angled into leg, it comes off the thigh guard an bounces behind square
good length, angled in, he defends on the front foot but gets a thick outside edge that runs to third man
cracking bouncer, 146kph, he ducks his head late to get underneath it
short and wide of off, 125kph slower ball, he cracks a cut straight to backward point
wide of the crease, angled into middle and leg, he works this straight to midwicket
back of a length, 148kph, he stands tall and punches to the gap at point
149kph bouncer, well directed, he's quick to get under it

holes out to deep square! The golden arm of Stokes strikes! A gentle back of a length loosener, he's back and trying to pick up a pull shot but he mistimes it and hits it straight down Root's throat at deep square. It's an easy catch. Everything working for England
129kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease
back of a length outside off, 133kph, he's up on his toes and punches firmly to deep cover-point
131kph bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks under it pretty well
136kph, back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot to point
130kph bouncer wide of off and called a wide
135kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
angled down the leg side and called a wide
angled into the thigh guard, 134kph, he glances this fine to the man at fine leg
good length, 138kph, slanting in, he defends on the front foot
good length, 136kph, angled into middle, he's defending on the front foot
short ball, lifting outside off, he arches the back and sways inside it
angled into leg, 135kph, he clips this off his toes in the air for a little way but short of Morgan at midwicket
back of a length outside off, he's punching off the back foot firmly to cover
136kph, shorter length on off, he's back and defending with soft hands
129kph good length on middle and off, he's back and punching back to the bowler
123kph, slower ball cutter, angled into middle and leg, he works this with the angle to fine leg
132kph, good length wide of off, he square drives elegantly on the up to deep point
128kph, bouncer, this hurried him, he pulls and gets a top edge off the splice but it lands safe
back of a length, middle and off line, he's back and punching to mid on
shorter length outside off, he tries to force off the back foot but mistimes into the off side
147kph, lifting short ball outside off, he drops the knee and sways under it
good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
141kph, fuller length, angled into middle and off, he works this with the angle to wide mid on
137kph, fuller on off, he pushes on the front foot into the off side
shorter length, 140kph, on off, he stands up and defends with the full face
on the hip and dabbed behind square for the single
tapped firmly into the covers, sharp fielding to close down the single ... a direct hit would have been close, but no cigar
round the wicket, angled into the left-hander, nudged to midwicket
fenced off the back foot once, constrained from round the wicket
no angle to work with there, as Santner blocks to the leg side
banged in short, Santner sniffs leather as he lifts his gloves high to defend into the covers
round the wicket, angled into the pads on a tight line
tucked off the hip to deep square leg
punched into the covers
nudged off the hip again, but takes a leading edge as Stokes takes a tumble at point to gather
sweet timing! Bringing the bat firmly through the line of the ball angled into the pads, and clean through long-on
on the pads, tucked square
on the legs, worked to the leg side
banged in short, round the wicket and angling into a cramped pull. Gathered on the bounce at wide mid-on
full length, worked to the leg side for another single
full, driveable, but drilled straight to short cover as Santner leans back on impact
flicked in the air from round the wicket, plops short of mid-on
crunched into the covers, on the back foot, can't get that one through the ring either. England tighten their grip
zipping through to the keeper, past a loose thrash
solid clonk of willow, but Archer swoops at cover to prevent the single
tapped to mid-on, angling into the legs again, another single. This isn't going to dent the requirement much ...
battered into the off side again, but there's still no way through
on the back foot, defended to mid-off... this is tight and tidy, and NZ are going nowhere now
that's better from Santner, a flick off the hip, over midwicket and a long chase for Wood, hurtling after the ball and committing himself valiantly to save the four ... careful now!
back of a length, short-arm pull through square leg
defended back down the track, off the back foot
short, and beats a flaccid pull as Buttler gathers above his head
pulled again, too tight to the body to free the arms, but a sprint to mid-on completes his battling half-century
through to the keeper once more
speared into the toes, well dug out, but that's another tight and varied over from Stokes
round the wicket, angled into the pads, this line is ideal for England's purposes
pressed to the off side, another pair to the rapidly sinking cause
well that'll help! On the pads, pinged firmly past the diving midwicket, and away to the rope
nudged to the leg side
taps the single to long-off

a bottom-handed bludgeon, out through extra cover, and Bairstow's despairing dive can't cut that off! He rakes a moment after landing, and may have jarred his shoulder there... honestly, commitment is one thing, but England might have bigger issues if their key players get injuries
defended once again
patted back down the pitch

banged in short, hopping down the leg side, a floppy paddle-pull, a wafer-thin edge, and the simplest of takes for Buttler! The slower ball suckered the set batsman completely, and that is officially curtains
on the back foot, punched into the off side
on the pads, flicked down the leg side
round the wicket, flicked in the air over square leg, a relatively productive shot for him
beats the edge, back of a length, pushing tentatively outside off

walks across the stumps, huge appeal, plumb in front! Santner reviews, because, well, you would wouldn't you. But that looked horribly adjacent... pretty sure there was no bat involved either. Indeed no bat, thumping middle and leg. New Zealand are eight-down!
thumped through the covers, an attractive way to get up and running. Root sprawls to intercept on the boundary's edge
down the leg side
eased into the covers
a swing of the bat, through the line, into the covers
into line to defend once again
twisting onto a good length and blocked
on the legs, worked out to the vacant square leg
fully forward, punched into the covers
poked defensively from deep in the crease
big loopy legbreak, dips and spins past a tentative prod. Buttler whips off the bails for good measure
flipped to square leg, right back on the crease
through to the keeper
sharp bouncer! Henry leaps back and jams his gloves down as the ball snaps violently at his ribs!
leaning back, another whistling lifter past the nose
much fuller this time, targeting the timbers but Southee is wise to it this time
chopped out to point
banged in short once more, chasing the tailender to square leg like a Jack Russell puppy with a postman. Except not quite as cute. Bites Southee on the glove for good measure
fenced off the pads to the leg side
skids through low, chopped out to point
leaning forward, head over the ball
beaten by the googly, but sliding down leg
a dirty hack through the leg side, leaning back and clobbering the ball from outside off
another juicy wrong'un, and that beats everything! Henry knew nothing as the ball turned back into his out-of-synch prod, and skims past the timbers and keeper too
solid areas, nothing doing
slower ball, 77mph, back of a length, tapped off the back foot to point
cracked into the covers
splatters the stumps! Timid from Henry, popping to square leg once again as Wood bangs it in just back of a length, and thuds into middle and leg. Nearly done here!
blocked into the off side
defended once again
flogged down to long-on
big legbreak, Boult crabs his way to the pitch and stabs to point
big googly, completely deceived on the charge
picked? Probably not. Picked up! Emphatically! Over cow corner, with the spin! Hurrah for tailend boshing! It never gets old
scamper, shuffle, dab! It's mental batting, and mesmerising
dragged out of his crease, off come the bails, is this it?Yes it is! Beaten by another big turner. The back foot stretches back, but too late. England are into the semi-finals of the World Cup!
